intro: Vernonanthura laxa, commonly known as the slender vernonberry, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It produces small, red berries that are edible and contain a single seed. Vernonanthura laxa thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
